sentence.text: ` You must be raving , " Silas snorted .
` He is the best American comedian since Jack Lemmon , " raved New Republic .
` Jimmy Montgomery comes in one day a week to coach the goalkeepers , and he raves about young Adrian Swan .
I had half expected him to begin raving about cursed women and sending Melinda to Asyut .
He was raving about Armageddon and the fires of hell .
A farmer has every right to rant and rave about such clowns .
He raved about that delicacy each and every time we met .
He raved about Hitchcock , about Bogart and Raymond Chandler .
The press here , like the list , are raving about Kelly .
Basically everyone raved about Leeds that day -- and Tuesday was a comfortable if a little uninspired .
If the popular music press start raving about you , people will flock to your gigs .
He was raving at Maurin , at all the people who had failed to live up to his expectations of them .
` He was ranting and raving at me , " the ward sister said , ` in German "
I raved at them , swore at them , gesticulated at them .
Matilda was still ranting and raving against the absent Earl for getting himself captured .
He was afraid to keep him in his own house because the old fellow rants and raves upon occasion and might distress Mrs Browning .
They got him down the line eventually , but he was raving by then . "
` Just think , " she raved on , as they drove past honeysuckled hedges and trees covered with reddening apples , ` six months in New Zealand .
Mavis was n't Henry 's favourite person -- she was a bit too loud and bossy for him -- but he felt quite sympathetic as she raved on about the Kelly Competition .
She was allowed to talk about herself if he was allowed to rave on about black men .
Luke would rave on about change .
And for about five minutes they rave about how flattered they are , a little bemused but clearly touched .
Every time I rave about how sexy Rancid Hell Spawn 's distorted , chaotic pop-stupidity is and every time you take not a blind bit of notice .
The village is fascinating ; the sort of place the press have been raving about for the past four years when they talk about ` unspoilt Turkey " .
` You 're raving , my child , " she said briskly .
` Fashion , my arse , " he 'd rave .
He raved and shouted .
